messages.content: he hecho un git checkout a un commit anterior, lo he modificado y ahora cuando quiero hacer un commit me sale que no estoy en branch actual

Claro, entiendo. Te encuentras en un estado conocido como "detached HEAD". Esto sucede cuando haces `checkout` a un commit específico que no es la cabeza de ninguna rama.

Para guardar tus cambios, lo más sencillo es crear una nueva rama desde el punto en el que estás ahora. Puedes hacerlo con el siguiente comando:

`git checkout -b <nombre-de-la-nueva-rama>`

Simplemente reemplaza `<nombre-de-la-nueva-rama>` con un nombre que describa los cambios que has hecho.

Una vez que hayas creado la nueva rama, estarás en ella y podrás hacer `git add` y `git commit` de tus cambios de forma normal.

thoughts.subject: Understanding the Problem
thoughts.description: I've begun to zero in on the user's issue. They're stuck in detached HEAD state after modifying a previous commit, and they are speaking Spanish. My focus is now on how to translate the user's issue and provide a clear git solution in Spanish.

thoughts.subject: Refining the Solution
thoughts.description: I've refined my plan to offer a solution. I plan to create the branch, and inform the user how to proceed. The translation is getting better, with more natural Spanish. I am thinking through how to best phrase the explanation of the detached HEAD state for maximum clarity.

thoughts.subject: Structuring the Response
thoughts.description: I'm now organizing the response, integrating the translated Git commands with the explanations in Spanish. I'm considering the flow of the response, leading with a clear definition of "detached HEAD" before presenting the solution. My aim is to be both accurate and friendly in my Spanish.

thoughts.subject: Drafting the Reply
thoughts.description: I'm now focusing on the response's tone and wording. I aim for a friendly and helpful approach in Spanish, including the Git command in a clear manner. I'll provide a brief overview of the problem and solution, and then make the offer of continued help.
